result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan R Colon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine is to be paid in full by 11-06-2015 or serve 4 days jail with huber as penalty for failure to pay fine.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan R Colon

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Juan R Colon in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  

State moves to amend count 2 to a County Ordiance D.C. 13.102(c)(8).
Defense has no objections.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to the amended charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended charge.
Count 1 is dismissed as a read in.

Court orders the following:
Fine:  $267.50
To be paid in full by:  11/06/15.
Alternate:  4 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).

Defendant Juan R Colon in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Debra Lynn Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment as the defendant needs to complete counseling and the state will amend. Court grants the request.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Jury status hearing on May 28, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Peter M Wolff in court.   
Defendant Juan R Colon did not appear.   
Atty. appeared by Authorization previously filed.

  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Authorization to Appear, received and filed in court.

Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Peter M Wolff  by Atty. Williamson in court.   
Defendant Juan R Colon did not appear.   
Atty. Appeared by Authorization.  Hearing scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
with Demand for Trial filed by Attorney Wolff.

Defendant Juan R Colon in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Attorney appears as friend of the court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Attorney Wolff requests a bail modification. Victim presents statements to the court. Court grants the motion. 
  Hearing scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Defendant is not to have any violent contact with the victim listed in the criminal complaint.
Bail was refunded, court ordered a $1,500.00 signature bond, not cash bond.
State appeared by Asst DA., Tim Suha. Defendant appeared in person. Defendant to sign bond that was previously ordered and refund bail that was posted at the Sheriff's dept.
No contact with the victim/witness Michael C. or his residence on Delafield St., except to pick up daughter to take her to school.

State of Wisconsin appeared in person by Law Intern. Defendant appeared in custody, with public defender, as friend of the court, Kelsy Morin.
Defendant's new address is 1160 N. 50th Street, Milwaukee WI 53208. Court orders a signature bond of $1500.00 with conditions of No contact with the victim/witness Michael C. or his residence on Delafield St., except to pick up daughter to take her to school.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
